noun.description: The restoration of something lost or stolen to its proper owner.
examples: seeking the restitution of land taken from blacks under apartheid
he was ordered to pay $6,000 in restitution

noun.description: The restoration of something to its original state.

origin: Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin restitutio(n-), from restituere restore, from re- again + statuere establish.
